Package com.craigwoodcock.fishingapp.config

Class SecurityConfig

java.lang.Object
com.craigwoodcock.fishingapp.config.SecurityConfig
@Configuration @EnableWebSecurity public class SecurityConfig extends Object
Security configuration class that defines the security settings for both API and web interfaces of the fishing application. This class configures authentication, authorization, session management, and other security-related aspects of the application.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Craig Woodcock

    • passwordEncoder

      @Bean public org.springframework.security.crypto.password.PasswordEncoder passwordEncoder()
      Creates and configures the password encoder bean for secure password hashing.
      Returns:
      BCryptPasswordEncoder instance for password encryption

    • customAuthenticationEntryPoint

      @Bean public CustomAuthenticationEntryPoint customAuthenticationEntryPoint()
      Creates and configures the custom authentication entry point bean. This entry point handles unauthorized access attempts to secured endpoints.
      Returns:
      CustomAuthenticationEntryPoint instance

    • customAccessDeniedHandler

      @Bean public CustomAccessDeniedHandler customAccessDeniedHandler()
      Creates and configures the custom access denied handler bean. This handler manages responses when authenticated users attempt to access resources they don't have permission for.
      Returns:
      CustomAccessDeniedHandler instance

    • apiSecurityFilterChain

      @Bean @Order(1) public org.springframework.security.web.SecurityFilterChain apiSecurityFilterChain(org.springframework.security.config.annotation.web.builders.HttpSecurity http) throws Exception
      Configures security settings for the API endpoints (/api/**). This configuration implements stateless JWT-based authentication for API requests.
      Parameters:
      http - HttpSecurity instance to be configured
      Returns:
      Configured SecurityFilterChain for API security
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during security configuration

    • webSecurityFilterChain

      @Bean public org.springframework.security.web.SecurityFilterChain webSecurityFilterChain(org.springframework.security.config.annotation.web.builders.HttpSecurity http) throws Exception
      Configures security settings for web interface endpoints. This configuration implements form-based authentication with session management for the web application.
      Parameters:
      http - HttpSecurity instance to be configured
      Returns:
      Configured SecurityFilterChain for web security
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during security configuration
